body: Can Cython use Python type hints?

comment_data.body:
Yes. Did you search anywhere for an answer before opening a bug ticket? I don't see how this is a bug.
Please use the mailing list for questions and support requests.

I only see it mentioned in the changelog. It would be worth mentioning this more prominently in the Cython documentation as well.
I recently listened to a popular python podcast where they were comparing cython to another similar project (https://github.com/JukkaL/mypyc) and the speaker wrongly assumed that cython did not support PEP-484 and PEP-526 type annotations.

We could probably advertise it more prominently, but it's at least documented in the "expected" place:
http://docs.cython.org/en/latest/src/tutorial/pure.html#static-typing
oh, thanks for the link, I missed that.

Thanks for bringing this up, BTW, and sorry for sounding a bit harsh initially. It does seem like a common misconception to think that "you have to change your code in order to use Cython" and "Cython can't compile Python code". Both of these hydra myths are really hard to cut off, and can easily prevent people from letting Cython solve their problems.

Here would also be a good place: http://docs.cython.org/en/latest/src/quickstart/cythonize.html

The title of that page is "Faster code via static typing" but it only talks about types in the context of Cython code AFAICT, not Python-with-type-annotations.

@anentropic Improvements to the documentation are obviously always welcome, and you're probably right that it's a bit sparse in type hints. I'd think it's probably in the right place in https://cython.readthedocs.io/en/latest/src/tutorial/pure.html - but maybe could be picked out a little better (as a separate section perhaps?).

The "quickstart" guide should be quick rather than comprehensive, and it's probably sensible for it to focus on Cython's "main" syntax.

@dave-doty There is a small amount of documentation for type hints - the section starting

> Since version 0.27, Cython also supports the variable annotations defined in PEP 526.

(I see you've spotted this yourself too)

Obviously it could be better documented and improvements are always welcome. As you note `int` is the main pain point. The other "limitation" is that things like `Dict[int, str]` (containers with fixed types in) are useless to Cython and that's unlikely to change.

@dave-doty (and other people that complained about this...) - I've [tried to improve the documentation a little](https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/3799). It doesn't add a lot of extra information but it does put annotation typing in its own section, which should hopefully make it easier to find for people who are searching for it. Obviously further improvements from others are still welcome.

title: Can Cython use Python type hints?
